title: How to Cook Pan Fried Halibut Fillets With Olive Relish

steps.headline: Mix together flour, salt and pepper.
Dredge the ish fillets in the seasoned flour mixture.
Add the butter and olive oil to the skillet.
Heat butter and olive oil until almost nutty brown.
Add the fish fillets skin-side-up and cook until browned.
steps.description: This should take 3 to 5 minutes per side.

steps.headline: Flip the fish fillets and brown the other side.
Coarsely chop the roasted tomatoes packed in olive oil.
steps.description: Reserve 2 tablespoons of the olive oil used to pack the tomatoes.

steps.headline: Add the olives and tomatoes to a bowl.
Add the reserved olive oil to the olives and tomatoes.
Season with a bit of salt and pepper.
Mix to coat olives and tomatoes.
Remove browned fish fillets from the pan.
Plate and top with olive relish.

text: Mix together flour, salt and pepper.  Dredge the ish fillets in the seasoned flour mixture.  Add the butter and olive oil to the skillet.  Heat butter and olive oil until almost nutty brown.  Add the fish fillets skin-side-up and cook until browned. This should take 3 to 5 minutes per side. Flip the fish fillets and brown the other side.  Coarsely chop the herb-flavored olives.  Coarsely chop the roasted tomatoes packed in olive oil. Reserve 2 tablespoons of the olive oil used to pack the tomatoes. Add the olives and tomatoes to a bowl.  Add the reserved olive oil to the olives and tomatoes.  Season with a bit of salt and pepper.  Mix to coat olives and tomatoes.  Remove browned fish fillets from the pan.  Plate and top with olive relish.  Finished.
